intro: Stylidium centrolepoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf stickyseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its unique feature is the sticky, fleshy seeds that adhere to animals, aiding in seed dispersal. Stylidium centrolepoides is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
